body_html:
I'm now able to build now. Haven't tested it yet, will report back if I find any issues. @peterjc123, thanks a million for all your work.

One thing to be careful about - while building, you must use the x64 version of the developer command prompt. The exe for this prompt can be found at (on my computer, likely in a similar place on yours): C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Visual Studio 2017\Visual Studio Tools\VC

There is also a "Developer Command Prompt for VS 2017" in C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Visual Studio 2017\Visual Studio Tools, don't use that one as that is a 32 bit application and causes a mismatch in size_t declaration.

One thing to be careful about - while building, you must use the x64 version of the developer command prompt. The exe for this prompt can be found at (on my computer, likely in a similar place on yours): C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Visual Studio 2017\Visual Studio Tools\VC
There is also a "Developer Command Prompt for VS 2017" in C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Visual Studio 2017\Visual Studio Tools, don't use that one as that is a 32 bit application and causes a mismatch in size_t declaration.
body:
I'm now able to build now. Haven't tested it yet, will report back if I find any issues. @peterjc123, thanks a million for all your work.

One thing to be careful about - while building, you must use the x64 version of the developer command prompt. The exe for this prompt can be found at (on my computer, likely in a similar place on yours): C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Visual Studio 2017\Visual Studio Tools\VC

There is also a "Developer Command Prompt for VS 2017" in C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Visual Studio 2017\Visual Studio Tools, don't use that one as that is a 32 bit application and causes a mismatch in size_t declaration.
